BME425.name: Biomaterials and Biocompatibility
BME425.description: Materials science of human implants. Design requirements imposed by the human body, and need for bodily protection.
BME425.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering.

BME444.name: Biosensors for Medical Diagnostics
BME444.description: Biosensors, their components, properties, and associated electronics for applications in medical diagnostics.
BME444.prerequisite: (BS 161 or BS 181H or LB 145) and (CEM 141 or CEM 151) and (ECE 302 or ECE 345 or BE 334 or CEM 333)
BME444.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Engineering.

BME490.name: Independent Study
BME490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
BME490.description: Individualized reading and research in biomedical engineering or bioengineering.

BME490A.name: Independent Study in Clinical Biomechanics
BME490A.description: Individualized reading and research in the application of biomechanics to clinical cases.

BME490B.name: Independent Study in Biomaterials
BME490B.description: Individualized reading and research in the application of biomaterials.

BME491.name: Special Topics
BME491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
BME491.description: Special topics in biomedical engineering or bioengineering.

BME494.name: Biofluid Mechanics and Heat Transfer
BME494.description: Applications of fluid mechanics, heat transfer, and thermodynamics to biological processes, including blood flow in the circulatory system, heart function, effects of heating and cooling on cells, tissues, and proteins. Pharmacokinetics.
BME494.prerequisite: (ME 410 or concurrently) or (CHE 311 or concurrently) or (BE 350 or concurrently)
BME494.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Engineering.

BME495.name: Tissue Mechanics
BME495.description: Application of solid mechanics to understanding mechanical responses of biological tissues. Microstructure and biological function for soft and hard connective tissues and muscle.
BME495.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Engineering.

BME497.name: Biomechanical Design in Product Development
BME497.description: Biomechanical product design with application to people or animals. Synthesis, prototyping, and analysis of designs. Project management. Market research.
BME497.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Mechanical Engineering.

BME803.name: Research Methods
BME803.description: Skills required for graduate research. Critically reviewing the literature, defining a fundamental research problem, effective oral and written technical presentations, ethics and statistics.

BME841.name: Translational Innovations Laboratory
BME841.description: Mentored research conducted in multidisciplinary team. Translational research. Development of biomedical technologies. Teamwork skills.
BME841.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Department of Biomedical Engineering or approval of department.

BME844.name: Biosensor Principles and Applications
BME844.description: Nanotechnology-based biosensors, their components, desirable properties, and associated electronics. Applications related to healthcare, biodefense, food and water safety, agriculture, bio-production, and environment. Multidisciplinary interactions necessary for biosensor development.

BME891.name: Selected Topics in Biomedical Engineering
BME891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
BME891.description: Special topics in biomedical engineering of current importance.

BME892.name: Biomedical Engineering Seminar
BME892.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
BME892.description: Presentations of detailed studies of one or more specialized aspects of biomedical engineering

BME899.name: Master's Thesis Research
BME899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

BME999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
BME999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
